xtc.lang.cpp
Class HeaderFileManager

java.lang.Object
  xtc.lang.cpp.HeaderFileManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
Stream
public class HeaderFileManager
extends Object
implements Stream

This class manages the lexing of input files as well as finding headers.

Version:
$Revision: 1.55 $

Nested Class Summary
static class HeaderFileManager.CLexerStream
          This class wraps the lexer in a Stream
protected  class HeaderFileManager.Computed
          The descriptor for a computed header.
static class HeaderFileManager.DirectiveStream
          This class collects the tokens of preprocessor directives
protected static class HeaderFileManager.Include
          This class abstracts away both a single header and computed headers that have to include several headers in different context.
 class HeaderFileManager.PFile
          A struct to encapsulate the data associated with a regular header.

unguarded

protected HashSet<String> unguarded
The names of headers that don't have guards. This avoids having to recheck a header for a guard when we know it doesn't have one

protected int line
The current line number. Used by the __LINE__ macro.

                         List<String> I,

Create a new file manager, given the main file reader, the main file object, and the header search paths.

Method Detail

scan

public CSyntax scan()
Get the next token from the base or header file. If we are in a header a see an EOF, we suppress the EOF and instead pop the header stack and commence reading the last file.

Specified by:
scan in interface Stream
Returns:
the next token.

getLine

public int getLine()
Get the current line number. The lexer returns 0-base number, but __LINE__ needs 1-base.

Returns:
the current line number.

getFilename

public String getFilename()
Return the current file name

Returns:
the filename.

end

public boolean end()
Determine whether we are at the end of the stream.

Specified by:
end in interface Stream
Returns:
true if at end of stream.

includeHeader

public CSyntax includeHeader(String headerName,
                             boolean sysHeader,
                             boolean includeNext,
                             ContextManager contextManager,
                             MacroTable macroTable)
Enter the given header file. Use findHeader to get the qualified header. Also checks for guard macro.

Returns:
a start header delimiter if the header exists, otherwise null

openHeader

protected boolean openHeader(HeaderFileManager.PFile header,
                             ContextManager contextManager,
                             MacroTable macroTable)
Open the header, finding and enforcing header guards.

Parameters:
header - the header descriptor.
contextManager - the presence condition manager.
macroTable - the macro symbol table.

findHeader

protected HeaderFileManager.PFile findHeader(String headerName,
                                             boolean sysHeader,
                                             boolean includeNext)
Get a header descriptor. If it's from an #include_next directive find the next header after the current one of the same name. This function builds the chain of search paths in the same way as GNU cpp.

Parameters:
headerName - the absolute or relative path of the header.
sysHeader - true if the header is a system header.
includeNext - true if the directive was an #include_next directive, a gcc extension.
Returns:
a header descriptor.

includeComputedHeader

public CSyntax includeComputedHeader(List<String> completed,
                                     List<ContextManager.Context> contexts,
                                     boolean includeNext,
                                     ContextManager contextManager,
                                     MacroTable macroTable)
Include computed header(s). Take a list of header names and a list of presence conditions. Note that because macros can be multiply-defined, a single computed include directive may expand to several possible header filenames.

Parameters:
complete - the list of computed includes.
contexts - the list of presence conditions in which the computed includes are valid.
includeNext - whether the computed include was an #include_next directive.
contextManager - the presence condition manager.
macroTable - the macro symbol table.
Returns:
the start include delimiter if the header exists, null otherwise.
